response_parsed.title: Optimizing Serverless Handlers Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a focused guide on optimizing serverless functions utilizing FastAPI, a modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.

key_points.point: Leverage Async Context Manager (AsyncContextManager) to handle asynchronous tasks efficiently.
Use the OpenAPI generator for static type checking and efficient request validation.
Optimize routes by minimizing the number of dependencies and avoiding expensive operations within the handler functions.
Implement caching strategies to reduce computation costs, such as Redis or Memcached integration.
Utilize middleware for reusable, non-business logic functionality.

code_examples.code:
async def example_function(request: FastAPIRequest):
   async with request.state.my_async_context_manager():
       # Your asynchronous task here

version_notes.note: FastAPI version 0.75.0+ supports AsyncContextManager out of the box.
Ensure your Python environment is upgraded to 3.12.x for the latest performance improvements.

caveats.caveat: Overuse of caching can lead to stale data or increased complexity, so use caution when implementing cache strategies.
Excessive use of middleware may negatively impact performance if not properly optimized and tested.
